div.ab:
Kitchen pots are made well, in order not to give a
bad taste to the food
, with the same
metal
the bells are made of
. It is true that
foun
ables
ders
mix in more
latten
to make them yellower, to make them more vendable. But the
latten
by itself, & at a mere touch, is
stinking
& of
bad odor
.

Latten
does not lose, or only slightly, its
calamine
in an
four Ã vent
when it is melted in a
crucible
, nor in a
wood
furnace
, but it does in a
bellows furnace
because
bellows
give violent fire.
